index.name: javascript
index.subtitle: JavaScript
index.about: JavaScript is a lightweight, interpreted, object-oriented language with first-class functions, most known as the scripting language for Web pages, but used in many non-browser environments as well such as Node.js or Apache CouchDB. It is a prototype-based, multi-paradigm scripting language that is dynamic, and supports object-oriented, imperative, and functional programming styles.
index.description: Watch screencasts over a list with the best free videos about JavaScript language.

videos.title: HTML Canvas and Images
videos.description: In addition to vector drawing, you can draw bitmap images into a canvas, and also retrieve a bitmap based on the content in a canvas.

videos.title: Drawing Text on Canvas
videos.description: With the HTML canvas you can easily draw text as well as graphics. Let's take a look at basic text manipulation on the canvas.

videos.title: Simple drag and drop with Observables
videos.description: Armed with the map and concatAll functions, we can create fairly complex interactions in a simple way. We will use Observable to create a simple drag and drop example with basic DOM elements.

videos.title: Using the map method with Observable
videos.description: Like an array, Observable has a map method that allows us to transform a sequence into a new Observable.

videos.title: Introducing the Observable
videos.description: In this lesson we will get introduced to the Observable type. An Observable is a collection that arrives over time. Observables can be used to model events, asynchronous requests, and animations. Observables can also be transformed, combined, and consumed using the Array methods we learned in the previous lessons.

videos.title: Create an Array concatAll method
videos.description: In this lesson we will write a new Array function 'concatAll' which will automatically flatten nested arrays buy one dimension. This will remove the need to ever use a nested loop to flatten a nested array.

videos.title: Chaining the Array map and filter methods
videos.description: In this lesson, we will learn how to build nontrivial programs without using any loops at all.

videos.title: The Array filter method
videos.description: In this lesson we will demonstrate how to use the Array's filter method to easily perform this operation with less code than a loop would require.

videos.title: The Array map method
videos.description: In this lesson we will demonstrate how to use the Array's map method to easily perform this operation with less code than a loop would require.

videos.title: The Array forEach method
videos.description: One of the most common uses of the for loop is to iterate through the items in an array. In this lesson, we will learn how to replace the for loop with the Array's forEach method - and shorten your code in the process.

videos.title: Get Started with LeafletJS Mapping
videos.description: Leaflet makes creating maps in the browser dead simple. With some HTML and 3 lines of JavaScript, we can quickly have a map displaying.

videos.title: Gradient Fills on the HTML5 Canvas
videos.description: When drawing on the HTML5 canvas element, your fills aren't limited to flat colors. You can use gradients to get smoothly blended color fills on your drawn elements.

videos.title: Drawing Path - Curves and Arcs
videos.description: When drawing on your HTML canvas in JavaScript, you aren't restricted to straight lines. Using curves and arcs you are able to create smooth curved lines.

videos.title: Drawing Styles on HTML5 Canvas
videos.description: You aren't limited to boring black lines when drawing on the HTML5 canvas element. Using styles, you can program interesting colorful images with JavaScript.

videos.title: Drawing Paths - Lines and Rectangles
videos.description: Now that we have an HTML5 canvas to draw on, let's take a look at drawing simple lines and rectangles with JavaScript.

videos.title: Introduction to the HTML Canvas element
videos.description: The HTML Canvas element allows us to access powerful drawing APIs from JavaScript. In this lesson, the first in a series, we will learn about canvas, and get ready to start drawing.

videos.title: ES6 Generators
videos.description: Generators! In this episode we introduce you to working lazily with complex array calculations with generators.

videos.title: Functions Scope Basic
videos.description: This or that? Javascript scoping can be confusing. This lesson covers the very basics of function scoping.

videos.title: Introduction to Lodash
videos.description: Lodash is a toolkit of Javascript functions that provides clean, performant methods for manipulating objects and collections. It is a 'fork' of the Underscore library and provides additional functionality as well as some serious performance improvements. If you aren't using Lodash, you should be.

videos.title: ECMAscript 6 Arrow function
videos.description: ECMAscript 6 introduces the 'arrow function' as a shortcut for creating anonymous functions with this scope bound.

videos.title: ECMAscript 6 Array comprehensions
videos.description: With ECMAscript 6 you have access to powerful array comprehensions for generating new arrays from existing arrays based on criteria you specify.

videos.title: ECMAscript 6 String templates
videos.description: ECMAscript 6 lets us use string templates to gain a lot more control over strings in JavaScript.

videos.title: ECMAscript 6 Generators
videos.description: Generators in ECMAscript 6 are first-class coroutines that produce encapsulated suspended execution contexts. Whew! Yield values and iterate over them until no more values exist in the generator. We'll talk more about practical use later.

videos.title: Introduction to ECMAScript 6
videos.description: Welcome to What's Coming to JavaScript. ECMAScript 6 introduces many new features to the language. We won't look at all of them, but we will spend time with the big new features that will fundamentally change the way we write JavaScript.

videos.title: Picking the ECMAScript 6 environment
videos.description: Because ES6 is not finalized, we will not find an environment that implements 100% of the specification. There are two environments we'll use: Google Traceur and Firefox Nightly

videos.title: SOLID JS In A Wobbly World Wide Web
videos.description: In this episode, you’ll see the following SOLID principles covered and see how they apply to JavaScript.

videos.title: AMD Build With Grunt And Rigger
videos.description: In this episode, you’ll see: UMDJS, Project Dependencies with NPM, Grunt-Rigger and AMD Build.

videos.title: The Jasmine Standalone Runner
videos.description: In this episode I will show you the basics of how to install and use the standalone version of the Jasmine testing framework, to write unit tests for your JavaScript applications.

videos.title: ES6 Arrow Functions
videos.description: Arrow functions are a short, succinct syntax for building functions in ES6. Not only do they make for more powerful functional code, they also help inside of callback by lexically binding this.

videos.title: ES6 Template Strings
videos.description: Template strings will make it easy to build strings, localize strings, and sanitize HTML. A marvelous addition to JavaScript.

videos.title: ES6 Rest Parameters
videos.description: Rest parameters make functions with a variable number of arguments easy, readable, and safe.

videos.title: ES6 Default Parameter Values
videos.description: There is a new syntax to provide default values for missing parameters.

videos.title: ES6 Spread
videos.description: The spread is syntactic sugar we can use to spread an array across function parameters, or into an array literal.
